[[Alexander Novikov (professor)|Alexander Novikov]] |known_for = [[Probability theory]] |prizes = Markov Prize (1974) |footnotes = }} '''Albert Nikolayevich Shiryaev''' ({{lang-ru|Альбе́рт Никола́евич Ширя́ев}}; born October 12, 1934) is a [[USSR|Soviet]] and Russian [[mathematician]]. He is known for his work in [[probability]] theory, [[statistics]] and [[financial mathematics]]. He graduated from [[Moscow State University]] in 1957. From that time till now he has been working in [[Steklov Mathematical Institute]]. He earned his candidate degree in 1961 ([[Andrey Kolmogorov]] was his advisor) and a doctoral degree in 1967 for his work "On statistical sequential analysis". He is a professor of the department of mechanics and mathematics of Moscow State University, since 1971. He was elected a corresponding member of the [[Russian Academy of Sciences]] in 1997 and a full member in 2011. {{As of|2007}} Shiryaev holds a 20% permanent professorial position at the [[School of Mathematics, University of Manchester]]. ==Contributions== His scientific work concerns different aspects of [[probability theory]], [[statistics]] and its applications. He has contributions to: *Nonlinear theory of stationary [[stochastic processes]] *Problems of fast detection of random effects (A.N. Kolmogorov Prize of Russian Academy of Sciences, 1994) *Problems of optimal nonlinear filtration, [[stochastic differential equations]] (A.N. Markov Prize of [[Russian Academy of Sciences|USSR Academy of Sciences]], 1974) *Problems of stochastic optimization, including "Optimal [[stopping rule]]s" *Problems of general stochastic theory and [[Martingale (probability theory)|martingale]] theory *Problems of stochastic finance (monograph "The Essentials of Stochastic Finance", English and Russian editions) ==Publications== [http://www.worldscientific.com/worldscibooks/10.1142/9609 Change of Time and Change of Measure (2nd Edition) - World Scientific Publishing] http://www.worldscientific.com/worldscibooks/10.1142/9609 ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{MathGenealogy|id=17541}} *[http://mech.math.msu.su/staff/shiriaev.htm A.N.
